bit.name: Cortana Hack
bit.tooltip: Sorts Cortana in front of other transparent geometry.

bit.name: Always Draw Sky
bit.tooltip: Always draws sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible.

bit.name: Don't Strip Pathfinding
bit.tooltip: Always leaves pathfinding in, even for multiplayer scenario.

tagblock.name: Squads

int16.name: Normal Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

int16.name: Insane Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)

tagblock.comment: The following default values are used for spawned actors

int16.name: Swarm Count
int16.tooltip: number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

float32.name: Initial Movement Distance
float32.tooltip: before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction

tagRef.name: Animation Graph
tagRef.tooltip: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

bit.name: Stop If Death
bit.tooltip: this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies

bit.name: Stop If Damaged
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged

bit.name: Stop If Visible Enemy
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy

bit.name: Stop If Alerted To Enemy
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy

bit.name: Player Must Be Visible
bit.tooltip: this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player

bit.name: Stop Other Actions
bit.tooltip: participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation

bit.name: Keep Trying To Play
bit.tooltip: if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play

bit.name: Player Must Be Looking
bit.tooltip: this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

float32.name: Trigger Distance
float32.tooltip: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

float32.name: Run-To-Player Distance
float32.tooltip: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

int16.name: Use This Object Index
int16.tooltip: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

int16.name: Set New Name Index
int16.tooltip: once we pick a unit, we name it this

bit.name: Wait After Until Told To Advance

int16.name: Addressee Participant Index
int16.tooltip: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'

enum16.name: Dialogue Type
enum16.tooltip: when this ending is triggered, launch a dialogue event of the given type

enum16.name: Dialogue Type
enum16.tooltip: when this ending is triggered, launch a dialogue event of the given type

option.name: If All Players In Trigger Volume
Player Shot More Than X Seconds Ago

tagRef.name: Inside Cluster Sound
tagRef.tooltip: play only when player is inside cluster.

bit.name: Use Adjacent Cluster As Portal Scale
Use Adjacent Cluster As Exterior Scale

tagblock.name: Spawn Data
tagblock.comment: Non-0 values here overload what appears in multiplayer_globals.

tagblock.name: Static Respawn Zones
tagblock.comment: Lower and upper heights can be left at 0, in which case they use defaults. Leaving relevant teams empty means all teams; leaving all games empty means all games.

tagblock.name: Static Initial Spawn Zones
tagblock.comment: Lower and upper heights can be left at 0, in which case they use defaults. Leaving relevant teams empty means all teams; leaving all games empty means all games.

tagblock.name: Atmospheric Fog Palette

float32.name: Spread Distance
float32.tooltip: how far fog spreads into adjacent clusters

float32.name: Maximum Density
float32.tooltip: fog density clamps to this value.

float32.name: Start Distance
float32.tooltip: before this distance, there is no fog.

float32.name: Opaque Distance
float32.tooltip: fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from viewer.

float32.name: Maximum Density
float32.tooltip: fog density clamps to this value.

float32.name: Start Distance
float32.tooltip: before this distance, there is no fog.

float32.name: Opaque Distance
float32.tooltip: fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from viewer.

tagblock.comment: Planar fog, if present, is interpolated toward these values.

tagblock.name: Flocks
tagblock.comment: Recommended initial values (for a sentinel-sized unit): neighborhood radius= 6.0 avoidance radius= 3 forward scale= 0.5 alignment scale= 0.5 avoidance scale= 1.0 leveling force scale= 0.1 perception angle= 120 average throttle= 0.75 maximum throttle= 1.0 position scale= 1.0 position min radius= 3 position max radius = 9

comment.title: Let me give you a piece of free advice.

tagblock.comment: Flocks with a neighborhood radius of 0 don't FLOCK, per se (in the creature-creature interaction kind of way), but they are much cheaper. The best thing is to have a non-zero radius for small flocks, and a zero radius for large flocks (or for 'flow-flocks', ones with sources and sinks that are intended to create a steady flow of something). Note also that for flocks with a 0 neighborhood radius, the parameters for avoidance, alignment, position and perception angle are ignored entirely.

float32.name: Neighborhood Radius
float32.tooltip: distance within which one boid is affected by another

float32.name: Avoidance Radius
float32.tooltip: distance that a boid tries to maintain from another

float32.name: Forward Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to fly straight ahead

float32.name: Alignment Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to align itself with neighboring boids

float32.name: Avoidance Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to avoid collisions with other boids, when within the avoidance radius

float32.name: Leveling Force Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boids desire to fly level

float32.name: Sink Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to fly towards its sinks

degree.name: Perception Angle
degree.tooltip: angle-from-forward within which one boid can perceive and react to another

float32.name: Average Throttle
float32.tooltip: throttle at which boids will naturally fly

float32.name: Maximum Throttle
float32.tooltip: maximum throttle applicable

float32.name: Position Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to be near flock center

float32.name: Position Minimum Radius
float32.tooltip: distance to flock center beyond which an attracting force is applied

float32.name: Position Maximum Radius
float32.tooltip: distance to flock center at which the maximum attracting force is applied

float32.name: Movement Weight Threshold
float32.tooltip: the threshold of accumulated weight over which movement occurs

float32.name: Danger Radius
float32.tooltip: distance within which boids will avoid a dangerous object (e.g. the player)

float32.name: Danger Scale
float32.tooltip: weight given to boid's desire to avoid danger

tagblock.comment: Recommended initial values: random offset scale= 0.2 offset period bounds= 1, 3
